instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.HALL_SENSOR_LEFT: What is HALL_SENSOR_LEFT? HALL_SENSOR_LEFT is a signal from the hall sensor on the left side of the machine that indicates that the lid has been closed. This is necessary for setting SMC_LID properly so the machine knows whether it is closed or open. When this is low, the machine will think it is closed which may cause it to go to sleep or have no backlight on the screen.
definitions.HALL_SENSOR_RIGHT: What is HALL_SENSOR_RIGHT? HALL_SENSOR_RIGHT is a signal from the hall sensor on the RIGHT side of the machine that indicates that the lid has been closed. This is necessary for setting SMC_LID properly so the machine knows whether it is closed or open. When this is low, the machine will think it is closed which may cause it to go to sleep or have no backlight on the screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes from sleep only
threads.message:
Good day guys
Have got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that crashes when it wakes from sleep, but this does not happen when I manually put the machine to sleep from the operating system. below are the sleep signal I measured

<SIGNAL>PP0V6_SLEEP</SIGNAL> = 06V
<SIGNAL>PP0V8_SLEEP</SIGNAL> = 08V
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLEEP</SIGNAL> = 1V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLEEP</SIGNAL> =1.8V
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> RIGHT = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> RIGHT = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>HALL_SENSOR_LEFT</SIGNAL>  = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>HALL_SENSOR_RIGHT</SIGNAL> =3.3V
PLEASE HELP

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes from sleep only
threads.message: Disconnect J9600 and test with known good USB macOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes from sleep only
threads.message: Forgot to mention, I tried the board in a different shell , same thing

threads.message: I did remove j9600, but it didnâ€™t boot through external drive , came up with a critical update error

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> crashes from sleep only
threads.message:
Disconnect touchbar and test again.
Also check what happens in safe mode.
